members.member:
PlateTrax device driver class.
This class represents an accessible PlateTrax layout device. A plate trax device is placed anywhere in the robot layout. In general it has a fixed reading orientation.
\ingroup Dev_PlateTrax
In general the PlateTrax device configuration is split into - a device specific part (depending on the barcode reader type): - 
link{Sias.PlateTrax,SPlateTraxDevice.BarcodeReadDistance}: optimal barcode reading distance for the used barcode reader. - 
link{Sias.PlateTrax,SPlateTraxDevice.BarcodeScanSpeed}: the allowed moving speed for scanning the barcode. . The device specific properties are stored device/robot configuration. - a placement specific part (where it is placed on the robot): - - 
link{Sias.PlateTrax,SPlateTraxDevice.BarcodeReaderOffset}: Barcode reader offset. - 
link{Sias.PlateTrax,SPlateTraxDevice.BarcodeReaderOrientation}: Barcode reader orientation. - 
link{Sias.PlateTrax,SPlateTraxDevice.BarcodeReaderPitch}: Barcode read pitch. - 
link{Sias.PlateTrax,SPlateTraxDevice.BarcodeReaderRoll}: Barcode reader roll. . The placement specific properties are stored in the layout as layout device properties. This properties are assigned on ef sec_attachlayout "device attachment". .
As the PlateTrax device is not movable it needs to another device used for moving the items to read in front of the barcode reader. Therefore it expects a device supporting the 
link{Sias::GripArm,SHandlingMethods} arm method class. You can define the used arm method class by assigning the 
link{Sias.PlateTrax,SPlateTraxDevice.Handling} property. If you do not assign it the first usable handling method class is used.
In general the PlateTrax device supports two different barcode reading possibilities: 
 a) Reading item barcode of an item actually in transfer
 This routines get a barcode handling method instance. It is expected that the handling methods Y/Z device has an item (  see 
link{Sias.GripArm,IGripYZDevice.CurrentItem}). This item is used for barcode reading. 
 b) Reading item barcode of a item passed to the method
 This routines will use the handling methods defined on the PlateTrax for - picking up the defined item - reading the item barcode - putting the item to original or optionally defined slot. .
The barcode reading error handling can be done by registering the 
link{Sias.PlateTrax,SPlateTraxDevice.BarcodeReadErrorHandler} event. If the event is not registered barcode reading errors will be reported using the ef ErrorManager.
%SPlateTraxDevice class diagram
\image html "SPlateTraxDevice.png"
  Supported   Modules   Types: - ef Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_TYPE_CONST "MT_BC_READER" (0x003C) origin sias barcode reader modules. - ef Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_TYPE_CONST "MT_SERIAL_IO" (0x003E) "new" serial I/O and barcode reader modules. . In addition mostly all barcode reader modules will support the needed CAN messages for this device driver, but it is recommended to use better fitting devices for them.
TODO: GetAccessMode/SetAccessMode design check TODO: Implement and document access mode dependent device display modes (Visualizations)

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.#ctor
member.summary:
Default constructor.
This constructor creates a device with all configuration members to its default values.

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary:
XML string configuration constructor.
This constructor creates a device by parsing the device parameters from the given XML configuration string.

member.summary:
Manual generation constructor.
This constructor creates a device by using the given parameters.

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.IsType(Sias.Core.SCustomPropertyCollection,System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Check if the specified custom property exists and has the specified type.
member.param: Custom property collection to search check
Name of custom property to check
member.returns: True if the custom property exists and is of expected type, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.NormAngle(System.Double)
member.summary: Transform an angle to its normalized form (0..360Â°)
member.returns: The same angle in its normalized form

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.GetBarcodeOffset(Sias.Core.Interfaces.IItem)
member.summary:
Get barcode offset of given item
The barcode offset defines the position of the barcode relative to the item reference. It can be defined as "BarcodePosition" custom property in the item. If it is not defined the item reference is used as barcode position. Generally it is recommended to define this custom property if an item should be used for barcode reading.
member.param: The item to get the offset from

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.GetBarcodeOrientation(Sias.Core.Interfaces.IItem)
member.summary:
Get barcode orientation of given item
The barcode orientation can be defined as "BarcodeOrientation" custom property in the item. If it is not defined there the method tries to determinate the barcode orientation from item positions.
member.param: The item to get the orientation from

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.GetBarcodeHeight(Sias.Core.Interfaces.IItem)
member.summary:
Get barcode height of given item
The barcode height can be defined as "BarcodeHeight" custom property in the item. If it is not defined a height of 10 mm is used.
member.param: The item to get the height from

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.BarcodeReadingVector(System.Double)
member.summary:
Calculate the barcode reading vector
The barcode reading vector defines the vector used for the barcode read move. It is calculated from the PlateTrax orientation, pitch and roll. \n This vector is to calculate the barcode scan move start and end positions. In addition it is used to calculate the motor speeds for the scan move.

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.ReadBarcode(Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods,Sias.Core.SPosition,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Read barcode from current item.
Read the barcode from the current item of the given gripper arm. Ignores the barcode information of the item but uses - as offsets between item reference and barcode - as barcode orientation (relative to the item orientation) - as barcode height . \b Important: This method does not try to get or put the item anywhere. If the Y/Z device of the given handling methods does not have a current item the method reports a NoValidItemAtGripper error.
member.param: The handling methods used form item transfer.
Offset between item reference and barcode
barcode orientation (relative to the item orientation)
barcode height (results in a scan move way)
member.returns: The read barcode or an empty string if no barcode is read
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: 1 hour

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.ReadBarcode(Sias.GripArm.SHandlingMethods)
member.summary:
Read barcode from current item.
Read the barcode from the current item of the given gripper arm. The barcode parameters (position, orientation and height) are read from the items custom properties.
\b Important: This method does not try to get or put the item anywhere. If the Y/Z device of the given handling methods does not have a current item the method reports a NoValidItemAtGripper error.
member.param: The handling methods used form item transfer.
member.returns: The read barcode or an empty string if no barcode is read

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.ReadBarcode(Sias.Core.Interfaces.IItem,Sias.Core.Interfaces.ISlot,System.Boolean,Sias.Core.SPosition,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Pick Item and read barcode. Pick up the specified Item and read its barcode. Ignores the barcode information of the item but uses - as offsets between item reference and barcode - as barcode orientation (relative to the item orientation) - as barcode height . After reading the barcode the item gets placed back to the defined destination slot.
member.param: - \b true: In case of a barcode read error the method returns the item back to its origin. - \b false: In case of a barcode read error the item is moved to its destination anyway.
Offset between item reference and barcode
barcode orientation (relative to the item orientation)
barcode height (results in a scan move way)
member.returns: The read barcode or an empty string if no barcode is read
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: 1 hour

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.ReadBarcode(Sias.Core.Interfaces.IItem,Sias.Core.Interfaces.ISlot,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pick Item and read barcode. Pick up the specified Item and read its barcode (depending on the items barcode information). After reading the barcode the item gets placed back to the defined destination slot.
member.param: - \b true: In case of a barcode read error the method returns the item back to its origin. - \b false: In case of a barcode read error the item is moved to its destination anyway.
member.returns: The read barcode or an empty string if no barcode is read

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.ReadBarcode(Sias.Core.Interfaces.IItem,Sias.Core.Interfaces.ISlot,Sias.Core.SPosition,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Pick Item and read barcode.
Pick up the specified Item and read its barcode. Ignores the barcode information of the item but uses - as offsets between item reference and barcode - as barcode orientation (relative to the item orientation) - as barcode height . After reading the barcode the item gets placed back to the defined destination slot.
member.param: Offset between item reference and barcode
barcode orientation (relative to the item orientation)
barcode height (results in a scan move way)
member.returns: The read barcode or an empty string if no barcode is read

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.ReadBarcode(Sias.Core.Interfaces.IItem,Sias.Core.Interfaces.ISlot)
member.summary:
Pick Item and read barcode.
Pick up the specified Item and read its barcode (depending on the items barcode information). After reading the barcode the item gets placed back to the defined destination slot.
member.returns: The read barcode or an empty string if no barcode is read

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.ReadBarcode(Sias.Core.Interfaces.IItem,Sias.Core.SPosition,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Pick Item and read barcode.
Read the barcode from given item. uses the Barcode offset (relative to the Gripper tool Reference point) and the given barcode orientation. Pick up the specified Item and read its barcode. Ignores the barcode information of the item but uses - as offsets between item reference and barcode - as barcode orientation (relative to the item orientation) - as barcode height . After reading the barcode the item gets placed back to its origin position.
member.param: Offset between item reference and barcode
barcode orientation (relative to the item orientation)
barcode height (results in a scan move way)
member.returns: The read barcode or an empty string if no barcode is read

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.ReadBarcode(Sias.Core.Interfaces.IItem)
member.summary:
Pick Item and read barcode.
Pick up the specified Item and read its barcode (depending on the items barcode information). After reading the barcode the item gets placed back to its origin position.
member.returns: The read barcode or an empty string if no barcode is read

member.summary: Get layout property

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.AttachLayoutData(Sias.Core.Interfaces.ILayoutDevice)
member.summary:
Attach layout data.
This method tries to attach the layout data found at the given layout device to the device. If this succeeds, it returns true. If it fails, it returns false. In this case the calling method should retry until it finds a fitting layout device.
member.returns: True if attachable, false if not.

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.GetAccessMode(System.Object)
member.summary: Get access mode. This method is used to request the current access mode.
member.returns: Access mode for the given caller object

member.name: M:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.SetAccessMode(System.Object,Sias.Core.Interfaces.SAccessMode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set access mode. This method prepares the PlateTrax module to allow the requested access.
member.remarks: Remarks: - How should we handle a timeout error? - If another thread is active in the devices read function, we will wait until this thread is finished or the timeout is reached.

member.name: P:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.BarcodeReadDistance
member.summary: Barcode read distance property

member.name: P:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.BarcodeScanSpeed
member.summary: Barcode scan speed property

member.name: P:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.BarcodeReaderOffset
member.summary:
Barcode reader offset property
The barcode reader offset defines the distance between device reference and the center of the barcode reader read windows.

member.name: P:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.BarcodeReaderOrientation
member.summary:
Barcode reader orientation property.
The barcode reader orientation is the orientation where the barcode reader reads the barcodes. It is defined as an offset to the device orientation.

member.name: P:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.BarcodeReaderPitch
P:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.BarcodeReaderRoll
P:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.Handling
member.summary:
Active Handling methods property
This property is used as handling methods to move the Items to the PlateTrax device. On default the first handling method block of the PlateTrax robot is used.

member.name: P:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.DeviceOrientation
member.summary: absolute device orientation property

member.name: P:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.DevicePosition
member.summary: absolute device position property

member.name: P:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.ReaderPosition
member.summary:
Barcode reader position
Absolute reference position of the barcode reader. In general the reference position is the centre of the barcode reader window

member.name: P:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.ReadingOrientation
member.summary:
Reading orientation
The barcode reading orientation defines the absolute orientation of the barcode reading vector. It depends on the device orientation and the BarcodeReaderOrientation (Offset).

member.name: P:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.ReadingOffset
member.summary:
Barcode reading offset property.
The barcode reading offset defines the offset between the barcode reader position and the barcode reading position. It depends on the read distance, the barcode reader orientation and the barcode reader pitch.

member.name: P:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.ReadingPosition
member.summary:
Barcode reading position
The barcode reading position is the position where the barcode should be placed for optimal reading. It is calculated from absolute barcode reader position (\b see ReaderPosition) and the barcode reading offset (\b see ReadingOffset).

member.name: P:Sias.PlateTrax.SPlateTraxDevice.BarcodeReadErrorHandler
member.summary:
Barcode read error handler property
This event is called if the device is not able to read a barcode. The application may return how to go on with this error. In addition to a standard error handler this event is able to return a manual barcode. \b Important: To use a manual entered barcode you have to return SErrorResult.Ignore with the manual entered barcode at ErrorArgs.Barcode.

member.summary: Get/Set device visualization mode.

member.summary: Get/Set device visualization mode.
